item.description: Contact You can find me on: GitHub LinkedIn Instagram Or you can write me an email.

Jakub Pelc Illecillewaet Glacier, Canada, 2023 Bachelor’s degree student of Open Informatics at FEE CTU in Prague. [ swpelc.eu ] . [ contact@swpelc.eu ] . [ LinkedIn ] . [ GitHub ] . [ Instagram ] I’m interested in machine learning, drones, web development, astronomy, travelling, photography, and self improvement. Education Gymnázium Benešov (2014 - 2022) Bachelor (2022 - ongoing) Open Informatics (FEE CTU, Prague, Czech Republic) Experience Lecturer at Technologická gramotnost (2022-present)

Energoplay In the year 2021 as a part of team of 3, we created a project called Energoplay, an interactive game focused en energetics and sustainability. This project won the 1st place in the national finals of Energetická olympiáda. We then worked for about a year (during our spare time) on the project with the help of Energetická gramotnost, ČEPS and FEE CTU, and released it publicly in the following year.

InstallFest 2024 I have presented my project QtRvSim Web Evaluation at InstallFest 2024 in Prague, Czech Republic. A conference for Linux and open-source enthusiasts. The slides of this talk can be viewed here (English). The talk is also recorded on YouTube (Czech). An article about it can also be found on root.cz. The conference has also been attended by Mitch Altman, the co-founder of Noisebridge hackerspace, and the inventor of TV-B-Gone, whose talk has been very inspiring.

Hello, I’m Jakub Pelc I’m a bachelor’s degree student of Open Informatics at FEE CTU in Prague. I’m interested in: machine learning drones web development astronomy travelling photography NixOS❄ and much more. I also part time work as a lecturer at Technologická gramotnost and Škoda Auto. I help with organizing Astronomická expedice. See my CV or the list of links below if you are interested. Thank you!

QtRVSim web evaluation This is a web evaluation system for student RISC-V submissions in course b35apo. Users can submit their RISC-V (in some cases C) code, and it will be evaluated using QtRvSim (will be checked for correct output), and the runtime will be measured (in cycles). The app is written in Python using Flask framework, the database system is PostgreSQL. The main aim of the app is to provide a simple and easy way to implement a task (create a new task), and to be modular in a way (so it is possible to extend this system by writing another evaluator module for another language).
